column4: in your /etc/X11/xorg.conf change Driver "kbd" to Driver "keyboard"
yes your right sorry, that should have been the other way, keyboard is depreciated
i just read a doc the other day about differences in xorg and xfree config, and my memory was a bit cloudy, just looked again to refresh

the kbd is working fine....but as soon as I run sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart then the y and z gets switched...if I change it to use xfree86 and keyboard or just keyboard no changes are made when I restart the service again
yeah, that was the other thing that was confusing me, xorg 6.7.x and xfree 4.4 both use keyboard, and xorg 6.8.x uses kbd iirc
well I am going to test another thing now
which is odd because if thats the case, im using xorg 6.8.1 myself, and the keyboard driver
I can try it again if you want to
have you tried doing changes or even tried /etc/init.d/gdm restart?
its not when it first boots up...that works fine when it goes from a reboot or something...its when I need to restart X that it changes the keys
tried using the keyboard driver now...I still get the same result
ok, that sounds like some kind of a bug then
but ive not seen similar problems
the logfile is happy with kbd
